newsitem.title: USA: Two planes collide at Illinois airport - police.
newsitem.headline: Two planes collide at Illinois airport - police.

text.p: Two planes collided on the ground and burst into flames at the local airport at Quincy, Illinois, on Tuesday, police said.
A police spokeswoman said a United Air commuter plane flight arriving from Burlington, Iowa, crashed with a small plane at the municipal airport.
She had no information on fatalities, but CBS television reported that there were "multiple fatalities" in the crash involving a 19-seater regional commuter plane.
CNN said a United Express commuter plane with seven to nine people on board was landing when it collided with the smaller private plane believed to be taking off.
The private plane had two people on board, CNN said, adding that the planes crashed into each other on the ground and were engulfed in flames.
Local police told Reuters that the crash occurred at 6:02 p.m. EST (2300 GMT).
Quincy is located on the Mississippi River, 105 miles (170 km) north of St. Louis and 210 miles (340 km) south west of Chicago.
